item.title: How to Write Clearly
item.description: Think about the readers needs The most valuable strategy for communication is the simplest: clarity. When you communicate with clarity, people spend less time trying to interpret what you’re saying. As a result, they’ll understand you faster, and with less effort. Try to make what you’re saying quick to read and understand, people will then read more of it, and ask fewer questions afterwards. It helps to be a user-centered, or reader-centered.
